definition: to take one's time making a decision (idiom)/to consider at length

from/through/via/to follow/to obey/to engage in (an activity)/never (in negative sentence)/(Taiwan pr. [zong4]) retainer/assistant/auxiliary/subordinate/related by common paternal grandfather or earlier ancestor
to calculate/to compute/to count/to regard as important/to plan/ruse/meter/gauge

sentences.english: In the long run, the best is unquestionably the cheapest.
sentences.chinese: 從長計議，最好的無疑是最便宜的。

sentences.english: The head of the company's U.S. operations, however, says Huawei is willing to play the long game.
sentences.chinese: 但華爲美國公司的負責人說，華爲願意從長計議。

sentences.english: Our problems are "structural, " and will take many years to solve.
sentences.chinese: 我們的問題是“結構性”的，需要從長計議。

sentences.english: As aresult they're more able to take a long-term view.
sentences.chinese: 因此，他們更能夠從長計議。
